title: High-end, luxury type replacement for Times New Roman?
content:
My high-end academic company has used Times New Roman as their "logo" for the last 17 years. It's even in giant silver letters on the office wall. I asked for the logo file and they said "oh, just type it." Cringe. Cringe.

As their new director of marketing, I'm trying to help them modernize. Fortunately, we're re-branding and they're up for a logo change, but I'm sure any extreme departure from Times New Roman is out of the question.

So, we're shooting for a high-end, classy, luxury typeface that still has some academic tendancies.

Does anyone have any suggestions?

I will definitely look at them all. Thank you!
author: kennymcnett

comments.content:
I've been using [DTL Documenta](http://web.archive.org/web/20120113104722/http:/www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/Documenta_rdrct.html) for a while now, I really like it, but it's expensive  
i've always been happy with [Hoefler Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20120113104722/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100010) too, actually, although the one supplied with OSX isn't anything special  
you'd better look at the full version, and the titling weights

Font Bureau Starling - as announced at TypeCon!

[http://www.typecon.com/talk.php?id=258](http://web.archive.org/web/20120113104722/http:/www.typecon.com/talk.php?id=258 "http://www.typecon.com/talk.php?id=258")

I'm a huge fan of Minion.  
Garamond has also nice features.

[Beaufort](http://web.archive.org/web/20120113104722/http:/www.shinntype.com/beaufort.html) has a few things in common with Times.  
There's an OpenType version (small caps, OSF, etc.) available, but not retail just yet.

I'm very fond of Lexicon. I've set a few academic pieces in it and it reads and performs very well. It's pricey, but nicely-made. You'll probably want No.2, with the higher ascenders.

[Lexicon](http://web.archive.org/web/20120113104722/http:/www.teff.nl/fonts/lexicon/index.html)

Mr Kolbus mentioned DTL Documenta, but you might want to look at their Haarlemmer (a revival of a Van Krimpen face).

[DTL homepage](http://web.archive.org/web/20120113104722/http:/www.dutchtypelibrary.com/)
Loving it. Thanks everybody. Happy to look at more suggestions while I mull these over.
